revised_title: Kinetic Spectroscopy in the Vacuum Ultra-Violet Region: Dissociation Energy of SO and Combustion of Hydrogen Sulfide, Carbon Disulfide, and Carbonyl Sulfide
tldr: The authors used kinetic spectroscopy in the vacuum ultra-violet region to study the combustion of hydrogen sulfide, carbon disulfide, and carbonyl sulfide. They discovered a new spectrum of the SO radical and found the dissociation energy for SO to be 127 kcal/mol. The study also revealed a new transient spectrum in the hydrogen sulfide and carbon disulfide reactions, which helped in understanding the reaction mechanisms for the combustion of these compounds.
